title: What do people do on your main that "trigger" you?

replies.body: {{champion:122}} players maxing W second
I'd guess that you'd go with the E second

{{champion:28}} taking cotc 

honestly just fucking kill yourself this happens way to much
Not winning as {{champion:14}}
{{champion:14}}  Not building 40% CDR, never quick casting Q for the slow, and then complaining that his CC is too unreliable. Triggers me so hard.

{{champion:19}} not skilling E and instead maxing out W. Why do they need so much attack speed? How do they chase without E? They couldn't get even a Cho'Gath...

This, ofc, until next patch.
I alternate between W and E. I max Q first though.
That's good enough, depends on your playstyle. But having no point at all in E till lvl 10 means you are useless as a ganker.
wtf why would anyone do that to themselves
{{champion:42}} Using the package to farm lanes
Sometimes if your package is about to run out you might as well use it instead of letting it run out
{{champion:157}} Running TLD, CoC or Grasp.
Got it, run DFT.
No, run Windspeaker's for his passive shield.
You're right, what was I thinking?

{{champion:266}} Not being aggressive early. Not using his empowered W to win early trades. Building tank items first. (he needs at least a {{item:3153}} or {{item:3074}}) Building Titanic Hydra. Taking Warlord's. Fervor is ALWAYS better.
You mean you see other people playing Aatrox?
Lol

what do you build on kogmaw now?

> [{quoted}](name=Silencega,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=WtrRdrGb,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2017-01-12T03:19:42.421+0000)
>
> what do you build on kogmaw now?

Theres two main builds floating around being BOTRK into Runaans into either crit based damage or tank or Wits End into Guinsoos into tank. Both work quite well in my expereince.

> [{quoted}](name=NearChance,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=WtrRdrGb,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2017-01-12T03:21:29.656+0000)

is kog worth learning, and is he easy to learn, i have him ,but he seems like he isntas forgiving or easy as kalista, another adc i want to learn, which do you recommend for learning adc

> [{quoted}](name=Silencega,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=WtrRdrGb,comment-id=0004000100000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T04:04:16.423+0000)
>
> is kog worth learning, and is he easy to learn, i have him ,but he seems like he isntas forgiving or easy as kalista, another adc i want to learn, which do you recommend for learning adc

I'm not going to lie I love Kog'Maw I really do but he honestly isn't that worth it. He requires perfect positioning and has no mobility (except a speed buff when he dies) or hard cc. In fights he is extremely easy to focus down if he even slightly steps out of line and laning with him is hell if you fall behind especially due to how easy you are to gank. 

His rewards are very clear position well and if you do proceed to see you did well over 90k damage that game and kill people as they're running at you. His only spellls you really notice an impact on are W and E as AD kogmaw as E slows and W gives more damage and range Q is only ranked for it's %ATK speed growth and if that wasn't there wouldn't be touched until level 12ish as there is not much use of it early game. Ultimate can cost a lot of mana if spammed however needs to be used to pick off stragglers or check bushes as it grants vision. 

ADC reccomendations are a bit hard for me as I only know how to play Kog'Maw Draven and Kalista as an ADC however for a beginner I would reccomend
{{champion:51}}  - Traps for CC, long range, and an escape. Pretty safe and strong champion at the moment.
{{champion:222}}  - A hypercarry with a global execute and two forms of CC being a stun?(it may be a snare I'm not to sure) and a rather strong slow. A global execute can easily help out teams and Kill Secure yourself into an adcantage
{{champion:81}} - While he is a unique ADC in he doesn't Auto as much but he does have CC ONLY after getting Iceborn Gauntlet making him slow more than a Karthus with Rylias, A second flash, and another global spell. 
{{champion:202}} - Unique mechanic on an ADC who can pump out loads of damage. He possesses invisible traps which slow, a long range root, a long range ult which can easily execute enemies, and movespeed on crits. While I don't think he is to great for a beginning ADC player learning him will be beneficial to your ADC roster.

Not building {{item:3078}} on {{champion:41}} is the fucking worst.
Not using Keg combos is bad.
Not using mastery 7 emote is worse.
But not building Trinity Force is realistically the worst thing you can do on GP
I fucking suck at GP but when I get that 2000 crit barrel in the teamfight, shit goes down.

1200 is a more realistic number these days, but yes.
Big Crits are likely to deal big damage :^)

Also, what are these downvotes to litterally every comment? lol

{{champion:23}}  running warlord's

I don't even care about the build

{{champion:21}} running DFT.

There's one reason to run it on her, and that's to cheese the enemy with Q bounces. They're cheese enough if you know what you're doing so DFT tells me you don't main MF.
If you do the math on mf her ult if you land every wave at level one is roughly 700 extra damage because each wave refreshes the dft so its actually really good on her

You seem to think that the damage listed on the ability is "per tick" not "over the duration".

Per tick, it's 2 + 15% bonus AD + 5.125% ability power

You're not getting 700 damage off 12 waves unless you have well over 500 bonus AD.
I lied mb im getting my info from Phylol on youtube and its 1200 extra dmg with full items and lvl 3 ult.

Yeah, I realized you were a little misinformed about DFT. Which is one reason why I say it about my main.

BTW, the actual math means you also have to take into account the per wave ticking, which settles at

Total damage = tick damage x (waves that hit + 1)

The extra 1 is because of the 2 second duration that enables an extra tick.

UMMm all i know is i got my information from a very good source and so i trust it you do what you want your just missing out on a lot of the dmg. Thats all im saying because tlords is good yes but it falls off late fervor and warlords are meh on mf because shes mainly a spell caster (or at least thats where a lot of her dmg is) warlords and fervor aren't bad but they are just extra imo i just really love the feel of the extra q dmg with dft in lane and the insane ult dmg

I use Fervor since I also buy hurricane and go crit on MF. I will never use TL for the same reason I won't use DFT, and TL is even worse on the cheese.

The other reason Fervor is decent on her is because her Q and R both gain damage from it, and her Q even activates it.

Crit also does a much better job of making her ultimate insane since it can crit as well.

I do go crit build on top of dft but i definitely dont go hurricane. That shit is just so bad on her imo shes not supposed to be an a/s adc i use her as a spellcaster first because one good ult wins a fight regardless of keystone and then auto attacks are secondary.

One, you should learn to edit your posts, rather than simply replying again. It looks spammy if you don't simply edit your replies into each other.

Two, Hurricane has its benefits that go a little deeper than you might realize.

- it enables her to wave clear better.
- It grants more constant movespeed (which is why I generally build it before PD)
- it works with both Bloodthirster (bolts proc lifesteal) and Essence Reaver (when you crit, hurricane bolts also count towards the mana regen passive)
- it increases stacking power of fervor (counts as an on-hit, so you can get up to 3 stacks with one auto)
- fervor increases bolt damage

It all ties in together, that's how far I go to make sure it all works.

Yea mb totally didnt think of editing XD
I see your logic though you like more of an AA mf and i like to use her as an ult bot/ caster adc like jhin (who is my main along with ezreal)
So i guess we both just have different builds on mf which is respectable was a good conversation i like hearing what other people do different than me in this game. its very interesting
{{champion:37}}  using stakato everytime

I have a few for people who play my man-candy {{champion:44}}.
For starters, when people take anything other than {{item:3302}} to start off. Taric needs the Relic Shield because the extra HP and the shield when you turn it into {{item:3401}} is irreplaceable on his builds. Sure, {{item:3069}} offers armor and HP and Mana regens, but it leaves his without survivability. People forget that in order to tank well you need armor AND HP, which is why it's imperative to take the Relic Shield.
Furthermore, people who take Q or W first also trigger me. These abilities don't function well without each other, and this is why Dazzle (E) is the best option for starting the game. Plus, it offers poke and an early stun, which can get you ahead since your opponents won't be able to effectively dodge without their entire kit at their disposal.
Playing {{champion:421}} with {{item:1416}} when everyone play her {{item:1401}}
